reviews.review:
解密神作，3d眩晕者的噩梦(据说很多人吐着也要玩的佳作)
相比一些纯粹动脑子的解密作品，此作带有略微的操作性。
谜题难度中等，种类多样，趣味性很强。
从游戏时长来说，仅仅主线的时间并不长，而且前面的基本都是小关，最后一关才是集大成者，不论关卡长度，谜题设定，剧情安排。可以说前面的小关都可以看作教学关，都在为最后一关做铺垫。整体主线也就十小时左右。
不过如果想要更充分的体验这个游戏，那社区里面的DIY关卡不能错过，这一点大大增强了游戏时长。这大概也是此作被誉为神作的另一个原因，游戏本身只是一个框架，游戏内容可以让玩家自己去填充，并且相互分享。我没有玩过社区的DIY图(碍于社区被墙的蛋疼因素)，所以这些DIY作品的质量无法评价，不过既然是集思广益的东西，那也必定良莠不齐。善于发掘有意思的作品也是游戏的乐趣所在。
总的来说，这绝对是一部可以长期回味体验的超值佳作。

Portal es un clásico y posiblemente el juego de puzzles más representativo de este milenio. Las mecánicas son sencillas y muy intuitivas desde el principio, la curva de dificultad es justa y respeta a cualquier tipo de jugador, la ambientación es perfecta y da justo con el tono de lo que quiere mostrar el juego.

A grandes rasgos (Y por si aún no lo conoces) portal es un juego que consiste en solucionar distintos tipos de acertijos mecanicos con el uso de una pistola de portales, los portales conectan un punto A con un punto B que tu desees y se pueden colocar casi en cualquier lugar del mapa. El objetivo general del juego es escapar de Aperture Science Labs y descubrir los misterios del mismo, el juego inicia con acertijos muy sencillos pero para el final del juego pueden llegar a ser realmente desafiantes.

Acompañando a esta mecánica de juego la ambientación del juego aporta balance y un entorno apropiado al juego, es importante entender que narrativamente hablando este juego pretende ser una comedia y toca tomarselo como tal, hay muchos huecos argumentales y la historia no se desarrolla particularmente bien, pero los comentarios dentro del juego son buenos, acordes a la tematica del juego y algunos cumplen con su cometido de dar risa, lo cual ayuda a la sensación de comodidad dentro del juego.

El único aspecto negativo a mi parecer es la duración, aproximadamente 2,5 horas para la campaña, y el uso del Source engine que suele traer consigo unos cuantos bugs aunque ninguno que sea realmente importante o efecte el juego de forma significativa.

En general le doy a Portal un 9.2/10
Absolutely one of the best games in the world, a simply m u s t h a v e.

I only just played this game, now, nearly 11 years after it was released. I remember my classmates in high school talking about this game but I only vaguely understood the mechanics as it was described to me and I thought it was probably over-hyped. I can say now certainly that it lives up to the hype and surpasses it. The puzzles are lovingly designed with painstaking attention to detail. The atmosphere really makes the game, with the subtle, understated story elements of the first portion culminating in one of the most notorious plot twists in video-game lore. The game is short, but thoroughly enjoyable throughout it's entirety. This also sets up the second game to build on the darker thematic elements by leaving so much mystery. 
This game still holds up strongly 11 years later, with graphics options that are able to be scaled up. I played on max settings and was impressed with how sharp this game looked, despite its age. The reputation of this game is so well deserved. Starting Portal 2 now!

EDIT: Played Portal 2. In some ways I prefer the subtle, undertstated story of Portal 1, though the second still leaves a lot to the imagination. The game play mechanics build on this first one, but the sheer amazement of first using the portal gun can't be matched.
This is a really fun ineractive game. Anyone can play and enjoy. This was the best game of 2015.

Portal, while not as good as its sequel, is still a very fun and polished game. If you never played a Portal game before, the goal is simple: complete each test chamber while using portals to your advantage. Now, the complexity stems from the puzzle themselves, However, most of them aren't difficult to solve at all. It really isn't until halfway through the game where the puzzles become more complex and really take advantage of the game's central mechanic. Though to be honest, my biggest complaint about this title is the length. If you know what you are doing, you can beat this game in 3 hours or less. Now for $9.99, that's a bit up there. However, what is there is still fun and enjoyable. There are also challenge maps and developer commentary to keep you busy as well. Overall, if you enjoy puzzle platforms with an interesting mechanic, then by all means pick this one up.

Logické hry nie su veľmi mojim sústom,čo však neznamená že sa nenájde výnimka. Tou je práve Portal. Hra ktorá umožnuje sa teleportovať z miesta na miesto s pomocou portálovej pištole a spolu s nou riešíť rôzne bizárne hlavolami,ktoré zväčša na prvý pokus nevýjdu a občas budete umierať. Cestou vás sprevádza umelá inteligencia GLaDOS,ktorá vás bude sprevádzať až do samého konca hry (kde dostanete vytúženú tortu ;) ). Vzhľadom k týmto faktorom bola herná doba pre mňa dlhšia než samotná hra v skutočnosti (the he he). Ale aj tak som si hru užil a s hrdosťou ju odporúčam pre každého kto vkročí do sveta Steamu alebo toho kto hľadá dobrú logickú hru.

Portal játék. Mikor először hallottam erről a játékról, akkor azt hittem, hogy dimenziókon keresztül játszódik egy történet. De mikor kipróbáltam, akkor sokkal másabb mint vártam. Egy játék amiben taktikákkal kell végig vinni a pályákat, és nem használhatsz mást, csak az eszedet és egy portalgun-t. A játékmenet lenyűgözött és a háttértörténet is amit mesélt róla. Minden embernek ki kell próbálnia, mert felejthetetlen élményt nyújt.

The cake is a lie.

[h1]"The Cake is a lie..."[/h1]

While the cake may be a lie, the beauty and the success of this game is not; Portal, can be considered among the classics of video games. Here's why:


[h1]Story and the Characters[/h1]

One of the things that i really liked about Portal was its simplistic, yet unique and intriguing story. You get the sense of mysticism throughout the game, and  that "something isn't right" feeling doesn't go away either. So you also feel tense when you are going through Shell's assesment.  You also get this "Half-Life" vibe aswell, and if you are careful enough you can even see some details that are connecting the two universes. I also really liked the details that were somewhat hidden, such as the radios, Ratman's Dens, and the other easter eggs and references. 

Characters were another important part of Portal.  I really enjoyed the awkard jokes and funny dialogues of GLaDOS throughout the game. As being the leading element, the narrator of the game, she is the most important character of the game in my opinion, and GLaDOS does justice to her role. After GLaDOS, the turrets were my second favorite. The contrast between the lethalness of the turrets and the cuteness of their voice was really amusing. Portal also managed to create an unforgettable character out of an inanimate object: The Companion Cube, which is really unique...


[h1]Game Mechanics and the Environment[/h1]

If you ever listen to the commantaries of the game, you will learn that the developers of Portal created a new collision mechanic and modified their physics engine just for this game, so that the game would convey a more realistic feeling for the users, and to me that is amazing.The recursion and the enter-exit mechanics of the portals were also impressive. 

The game itself, in the sense of level design, is actually a tutorial, with each chamber you learn a new game mechanic, and you get another type of chamber that is oriented for that new game mechanic (such as shooting two portals from the gun, double flinging etc). Almost until the last chamber, the game actually "secretly" improves the learning curve of the player. The game mechanics and the levels are so well incorporated into the game, that we don't even realize it, until the final boss fight. 


[h1]Extras, Soundtrack and the Community[/h1]

I always liked the games having extras, such as Bonus levels, skins, challenges, commentaries etc, that are unlocked by skills and efforts, not just by a credit card. In this sense Portal falls into the first category, which i appreciate greatly.

Another key aspect is the soundtrack. Portal don't have much songs in the game. The soundtack until the last chamber is subtle, but effective, it creates this unnerving and tense environment that i mentioned before. The credit song "Still Alive" is also a really catchy and entertaining piece that will definitely be an unforgettable part of the game for me.



Because of all the reasons that i mentioned above, I believe that Portal is a classic game. However that being said, I also would like to mention a couple of problems with the game: the game could have been longer in my opinion, it even feels way shorter if you are playing for the second or the third time, with the knowledge of the game mechanics and the levels. So the replayability value of the game decreases a little bit. 

Another thing that didn't clicked with me was the ending; it wasn't bad at all, but it felt too easy and a little bit repetitive for a final boss. It gave me the impression that the final part was cut. After dealing with many turrets in the previous chapters, which provided the "action" part of the game, i was expecting a little bit more...

But in any case, Portal is definitely a must if you want to play a unique, entertaining and a great game. I would recommend it to everyone... 

[h1]PS:[/h1] You could also checkout some mods such as "Still Alive" or "Rexaura" if you want to play more advanced chambers, i would also recommend them too!

i have a mixed review for this game. it has 19 puzzles to solve, the first dozen were challenging and fun. then they got strange for me, in that i never grasped the way the some physical laws of the puzzles worked.  i had to check a walkthrough for hints on some puzzles.

furthermore, the bouncing and turning of the screen at times actually made me dizzy and queasy to the point i had to stop playing. i never did finish the last two levels, partly due to this.

so it was innovative, clever for the most part, but for my old self, too much hand/eye work was needed to be fast enough to deal with at least some of the puzzles. i'm glad i bought it and enjoyed much of it. but i can't say i was thrilled with some of the puzzles where physics didn't make sense to me.

so i'm recommending it, but i do have the issues mentioned above. i'm giving it 3.5 stars out of 5.
Игра отличная. В чёмта даже лучше своих оналогов. Очень качественая пророботка. Жаль что только сюжетная линия в этой части короткая.

Если честно, игра так себе, бегаешь по уровням, везде одинаковые декорации и однотипные уровни "вынь да положь" На фоне этого, радует лишь боссфайт, но и он довольно тривиальный, 2-ая часть получилась лучше, тут графен роли не играет, я про атмосферу, ибо она самая зависела лишь только от желания разрабов, а не от технологии того или иного года Лишь песенка про разбитое "сердце" в титрах, как бальзам на душу. Вот и все.
